Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Noticed that cases 102, 104, and 105 have significantly longer resolution times compared to others.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Identified that escalations to Level-2 Agents tend to correlate with longer resolution times, as seen in cases 102 and 105.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Calculated and compared the total time between each activity in cases to pinpoint delays, identifying major bottlenecks in escalations and investigations.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Verified delays by calculating the exact time gaps between Escalate and Investigate activities for cases 102 and 105, as well as Investigate and Resolve for case 104.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Hypothesized that Level-2 agent response times and lengthy investigations by Level-1 agents are the primary contributors to delays.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Inferred that possible backlog or inefficiency in Level-2 teams and workload or complexity issues in Level-1 investigations are causing the delays.

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - IND
Text: Considered the impact of these delays on customer satisfaction and agent workload but determined no immediate ethical concerns.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: Used the rule of thumb that cases with escalations and longer investigation times tend to have more delays, which held true in most cases.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Revisited the timeline of activities for Case 104 after initially assuming it was escalated, discovering the delay was actually due to a long investigation phase.
